 Since I'm not using my own views on this issue, but adopting the "potenital" argument, here is what I would say:
 
 You begin with a couple who has no "potential" to make life. You end with a couple, one of which is now pregnant. Which has a greater potential for life? Pregnant woman. There are dead embryos, and that may be bad, but from a purely potential argument, from which duo maxwell seemed to be arguing, it doesn't seem to be. One cannot argue that more potential is lost than created.

Clive14

It's not just an IVF ban that the "pro life" camp should be calling for. They should also be calling for the banning of some types of the pill and intrauterine devices (IUDs or the "coil"). Both of these change the endometrium (the mucus membrane that lines the uterus) and prevent the embryo becoming implanted if fertilization occurs. In other words they cause the embryo to be aborted.
 
 From my experience, most Catholic pro-lifers are consistent on this matter: they oppose contraception, IVF and abortion. Most non-Catholic pro-lifers though are, as Duo suggests, simple hypocrites on this matter and arbitarily choose when embryo destruction is OK and when it's not.
